qas.question: How many restaurants does the island have?
Where are most of the nice restaurants located?
What do the French call snack restaurants besides les snacks?
What type of cuisine related events does the island host each year?
How many restaurants in St. Barthelemy serve Creole cuisine?
What is common in Italian cuisine?
What cuisine is fresh grilled lobster an example of?
How many West Indian cuisine restaurants are there?

context: French cuisine, West Indian cuisine, Creole cuisine, Italian cuisine and <b8_0>Asian<b8_0/> cuisine are common in St. Barthélemy. The island has <a0_0>over <b5_0><b6_0><b9_0>70<b9_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> restaurants serving many dishes and others are a significant number of gourmet restaurants; many of the finest restaurants are located <a1_0>in the hotels<a1_0/>. There are also a number of snack restaurants which the French call "les snacks" or "<a2_0>les petits creux<a2_0/>" which include sandwiches, pizzas and salads. West Indian cuisine, <b7_0>steamed vegetables with fresh fish<b7_0/> is common; Creole dishes tend to be <a3_0>spicier<a3_0/>. The island hosts <a4_0>gastronomic<a4_0/> events throughout the year, with dishes such as spring roll of shrimp and bacon, fresh grilled lobster, Chinese noodle salad with coconut milk, and grilled beef fillet etc.
